content: Good game, but horrible controls as per usual with square enix mobile games. I don't even know why I give em a chance anymore. Controls really affect gameplay and make it difficult just to talk to npcs in a town, let alone trying to avoid enemies on the field...

Hilarious to read the pathetic reviews bashing the game. If you expect to play this like another Final Fantasy or Dragon Quest game then you will get filtered HARD after a certain point. Learn the mechanics and think outside the box and you will be rewarded with a unique JRPG like no other. How fun and how much enjoyment you get out of this game depends on how you play. Just don't expect the game to throw you an auto win like all other easy simple games. Have fun and thanks for the port Square!
Old school jrpg. it's make me was a kid once. Awesome.

This game do not buy if you have any appreciation for time, there is a big challenge here but eventually you ask yourself why? It is not fun to repeatedly switch players after investing time in them, they have no backstory and frustrating to level each up only to die easily by an overpowered random enemy in a dungeon which in most cases as tougher than the actual bosses. The gameplay is monotonous and there is nothing to make it worth spending more time, not worth it, buy something fun.

Game is absolutely incredible, but the controls are just awful. The game is still playable despite the terrible controls, but it is very hard to avoid enemies, which is sometimes vital to progressing in this game.
Never played the original so I really enjoyed this

Meh, story is bland but overall I was looking for a challenge. Random 1-shotting throughout every stage of the game means there's not really anything you can do to preserve your characters. So why bother? I wouldn't call that difficult, just bad mechanics. I don't like how the enemies scale either. It makes levelling up kind of pointless.
It was working on my previous mobile MI A1, since I changed my mobile to Motorola Fusion Plus the game does not even start. Fix is required.

This is everything I wanted for RS2's official release with just one problem, the DRM is a pain and if you're going to have DRM, at least make it similar to Final Fantasy 5 especially for Romancing SaGa 3 so fix it Square

The SaGa series never ceases to amaze me with their excellent gameplay mechanics and fun exploration. I love the Free Scenario system as well, allowing me to play as I see fit. SaGa is one of the JRPG series with the highest replay value. Definitely one of the best JRPG series ever, easily surpassing most of the others.
Great game. It plays exactly like the original snes game. Touch control is pretty bad, highly recommended using a gamepad instead.
An eastern classic finally comes to the west. Great SaGa combat, intriguing gameplay mechanics and beautiful world building.
it's a really good port but the controls could still be better
Just wow, first fight dying in, heroes do literally 0 dmg or very little, most of attacks do 0 anyway. Do they even check the game before selling? Game is unplayable.

There are no sound options, I like to listen to podcasts/music while playing and the lack of ability to turn off in game sound is a major inconvenience. Never had a game I couldn't turn the sound off in, was a genuine surprise.
Awesome game and series ... Look up play tips before playing seriously challenging but also rewarding...
It's great so far but needs a reticule or a pad to show on screen, please add!
The best RPG game experience I've had so far with an interesting battle count system and generation gameplay
I always wanted to play this.
Thie game is awsame and nice to see it still gets updated. Its challeging but with the right time base rpg tactics, it sould be easy. Great game.
Doesnt work. Just downloaded and it doesnt open. Keeps crashing and stopping.
My favorite JRPG when I was a kid. Still my favorite now
Fun game, well translated to the mobile platform, cloud sync now works! !
App crashes every time I launch it. Running Android 10 on OnePlus 7T.
Needs bug fixes, game pad support, and Android tv support. Also fix the need to be online to play an offline game.

Ok. Love the game, but the controls are infuriating. I'm playing now and I just accidentally threw some very valuable consumanble items away because the directional control is difficult. Other than that, it's awesome.

This is a very difficult game. It was so difficult I did "New Game Plus" in the beginning, and even after that it ragequitted and uninstalled it. But I reinstalled it and ended up beating it. In the beginning I followed guides to the point; later on I used them less as I was actually progressing the story on my own. So I didn't unlock everything or see every scenario. I didn't the craziest characters at the end, but I found a strategy that basically wouldn't let the final boss breathe.

Have a love/hate relationship with SaGa games. They can be incredibly intimidating and challenging until you learn/master the unique mechanics, but the payoff is worth it to me, especially if you are a fan of old school jrpgs....but yeah the learning curve on this one is especially tough and not a game you can easily slide through. A lot of the mechanics are not properly explained but there are some great Tips videos on YouTube that helped me a lot!
Bad to control and the characters die too fast l was expecting things to be similar to final fantasy series but no the polar opposite
great game, controls are great.
port bad
It'd be great if this game did not rely on login credentials upon opening a near $20 game, but at least it only needs verification for 5 seconds or less.

I cannot log in the game and it stuck in checking..... please fix this 
problem .pls reply ......

I'm so happy that I can even play this game now since it's in English and available in the states. I've always been a fan of JRPG's for years and enjoyed Romancing SaGa on the PS2. After purchasing this over a year ago, I decided to start playing it regularly recently. Be advised that you will not be playing as the same group of people throughout the game because it takes place over many generations, like over 1,000 years. I'm getting near the end and so far, I'm getting my money's worth.

controls take some getting used to, but they're nowhere near as bad as the extremely-exaggerated reviews; you control movement pressing anywhere, and are not required to actually press the graphic element to do so. Great to see a full game wirhout iap's and this is why i own almost all of the square enix library on mobile

two stars for bringing back an otherwise completely lost game in english speaking territories. The inconsistent resolutions which kill the retro aesthetic could have been overlooked. The terrible on screen controls could have been overlooked. The weird issues with lag thay cause monsters to be able to move before you can, etc etc all could have been overlooked. However after trying for hours i can now say it is consistent that upon beating Wagnas my game crashes. Squeenix pay your porters better

Good luck trying to do literally anything. Menus randomly dont open, go to screens you dont want, select choices you don't want, go back when you try to select something, go forward when you want to back. Want to pause the game? The pause button works once in 75 presses. Want to choose your character name? Sorry, youll be tapping all over the place trying to get the game to let you input literally anything...then youll be tapping everywhere trying to delete the jumble of letters. DONT BUY!

Movement controls could be more responsive, but it does kind of add to the challenge when you cant dodge fights easily. Translation could be a bit better in some parts as it does have typos. Non-linear gameplay, tons of abilities and stupidly good music, especially during the mini boss fights. Please squarenix release RS3 now!
Controls don't work at all on droid
Online only DRM makes this game impossible to play when you'd want to play a game. Emulate instead.
This game is very difficult and offers no tutorial or explanation as to the skills/formations in the game.

I couldn't play the game properly due to the characters being invisible. 
Can barely tell where you're walking.

Romancing SaGa 2 is an excellent game. You follow a lineage of emperors and 
empress that struggle against the seven heroes. Character growth is done 
naturally, the more you use a weapon the better they are at using the 
weapon. You learn attacking skills in the middle of battle, and you have a 
few schools of opposing magic to outfit your characters so you have many 
opportunities to customize your party and characters.

Love the story, and the sequence of generations. Good fighting system, 
controls are a little sketchy but with time they get easier.

If you like games like Final Fantasy from the SNES or before era, this game 
is likely up your alley. It is "harder" than other Final Fantasy games 
(although for the most part death is but a minor inconvenience), but quite 
fun. My only quarrel is the lack of a more comprehensive tutorial to 
explain the game's dynamics inside the game, some of which can have a big 
impact in it and not knowing them can reduce your odds of beating the it. 
That being said, there are plenty of guides, tutorials, and FAQs out there 
to help you understand how stuff works.

This is a decent game.  I mainly purchased it as a time killer when im out an about....  and i cant even play it as i dont have an internet connection in my van for my tablet.... talk about dumb.... its like that for final fantasy tactics as well.

I am not familiar with the series and this is my first game. I am blown away by this game. It is a completely different experience than what I am used to. The battle system has a lot of depth for turn-based. The various mechanics are intriguing. The art design is vibrant. The on-screen controls are unobtrusive. Romancing SaGa is a great addition to anyone's library.

I gave this 5 stars because it's a fantastic game, provided you're familiar with the SaGa series and take the time to look up its systems. You'll easily get dozens of hours out of this game if it tickles your fancy, but do be aware that the controls leave something to be desired and can themselves be a struggle. It's irritating, but doesn't detriment my enjoyment of the game.   You really can play this differently every time, and retelling your RomaSaGa 2 journey to friends sounds a lot like you were describing a tabletop session rather than a JRPG. Characters die (often), but don't worry -- the game is built around that, and if it gets too hard you can restart via New Game+ and bring your emperor's items, formations, and skills to a new save game to try and do it right next time.  Read the Romancing SaGa wiki's explanations for the game's systems before starting, and be ready to check character types before you recruit them to spark their preferred weapon type's techs.
For such a great game, it's a shame that it has so few downloads.

This game has been a ton of fun, I have enjoyed every bit of the 20+ hours I have put into it.  The biggest issue I am having is a consistent crash after defeating Wagnas on the floating castle.  It is unfortunate because it has prevented me from taking on the scenarios in the order I desired.  Hopefully this bug will not carry over into the final scenarios.  If not for that I would absolutely give it 5/5

I love this game only problem i had was the drm issue.  Paid for a game and unable to play it offline sucks.  This is my first saga series game and i am very impressed with it.  Just don't  like that i am unable to play the game offline and need internet connection to play.
It's a great game and I'm glad 3 is being remade too. Remake 1 also! :D
The movement controls suck. The virtual dpad is too small and sensitive. Really ruins the experience when your character doesnt move the way you want him to move
Absolute nostalgic heaven! Two thumbs up! 😀
I was addicted to it. But i am now having issues when i am loading the game up. It freeze on the square enix logo, it flickers the logo. And wont do anything else.
An amazing game with the worst controls ever created.   If you can use a controller to play, then this is a good buy.
Absolutely amazing any rpg player should try it.

Controls are just fine. Just because this runs on Android devices doesn't make this a fast-paced game. This isn't a game to rush through - it's a true gem from the developers. I wish I'd known about this series a long time ago (as a kid I played FF3(us) aka FF6, Secrets of Mana & Evermore, and Chrono Trigger on the SNES. Those were/are my favorite single player games of all time, even after being a committed 'gamer' for the two decades to follow their release). The gameplay has the nostalgic charm (npc's walk in place, fun cutscenes, content drips in smoothly as characters develop, and the townsfolk - the townsfolk!!). It also has a new level of difficulty and excitement - characters have their own proper life points that can run out, so they can die permanently - there's also so much nonlinear content in this game - it's really hard to believe that it preceded some of the other trailblazing titles I mentioned. You can explore the world all you want (like an open-world game type of experience if you enjoy those). If your party gets wiped out, you might not be able to return to where you were so easily in the future. It's pretty awesome. Don't cheat with walkthroughs. Give it a shot. Just don't rush through it. The controls are completely workable if you pay attention to them. Also, save often!! But if your party gets wiped out, try to get yourself to take the chance to rebuild your party from the ground up (instead of reloading your file) - this is a really unique feature that sets this game apart!!

Never played the original and now I can't wait for 3 to come out. Love everything but the controls when moving. If they were more reactive like some of the FF remakes or at least were more sensitive to directional movement - the game would be phenomenal. Could just be on my LG G6 though.

Terrible. This is always online. I cannot play outside while sitting on the bank playing it offline. For that money which I bought means I do not own it. Square can go and F*** off. Square Enix site said no need for online connection. Bulls*t.
I really want to rate this higher and I will, but being in the military with lack of connection to the internet often for months, I cannot even play this game. And I bought it primarily for morale.
This game needs Bluetooth controller support. The touch controls are awful.

I've played pretty much every SaGa game except RS1 at this point. I was really stoked to see that an RS2 translation and remaster was available on Android. Everything about this port is amazing, except for 2 things that almost made me throw my phone against the wall:  1) The DRM that requires you to be always online. Whoever thought this was a good idea should be dragged into the street and shot. If you want to play this game offline and for free, you can download a cracked APK very easily. This is just penalizing those of us who paid a lot of money for this game with no benefit whatsoever to the publisher.  2) Formation-breaking. I'm ok with mobile controls being awful (and these are especially bad -- other Square mobile ports have been much better.) But the fact that these terrible controls are coupled with an archaic game mechanic that punishes you for using a convenience feature is just insane.   If these two snags were fixed, I would give this port 5* easily.

I bought this with the idea of supporting the game makers in mind while avoiding the cumbersome controls of an emulator but this is worse. I've wasted so many ethers I didn't need to and spent more time cursing at tapping the wrong thing.  This is a 12$ game at best not what I paid. If square wants to refund or give me a credit towards another I'd gladly take it.

I want to rate this game higher, but honestly cannot. The controls I can get over easily, but the DRM actively ruins it. It really is sad that this type of business practice only encourages more piracy. Over half the time I try to play this game I am stuck at the DRM check screen. Even went to squeenix customer support for help and it did zero to fix this problem. Avoid this game until they do something about the DRM.
After my feedback to the team, square has fixed the cloud sync issue. I can now finally play it on my shield TV!
JRPG lovers come hither.  Haters should go thither.

I had played the original on SFC in childhood and very glad to see it remastered now and in Eng which is better for me to understand the storyline. A bit disappointing though the character sprites look stiff and lifeless (saved awkwardly for few random enemies which have motion during the fight). And well, as others have commented, the UI n control sucks. Nevertheless, I stand by the 5 star rating for this epic game.

I do not doubt that the story is satisfying, I cannot say the combat mechanics are bad, and I truthfully don't know if the class system exists or sucks.. What I do know is.. For a re-release with a graphical update it isn't to my standards. Not for the price anyhow.

I've played romancing saga 1 & 3, so I finally get to play #2.  I would definitely play romancing saga 3 first, as there is more information on that game and you can play it on your PC or playstation.  Romancing saga 1 is great, but is pretty hard (and it is amazing how many monsters will mob you).  These games have similar mechanics, and you will either like them or not.  They are not as confusing as Saga Frontier (though with the FAQ's available, there is always a way to figure things out).  I'm playing this game on an emulator (Bluestacks).  It's not reasonable to play this type of game on a tiny screen IMHO.  The play control for moving is still poor (you need to adjust your keyboard repeat rate, and have a small pause before changing directions).  Otherwise the game is everything I could want from a retro game.    Because death is permanent, I find myself resetting when I lose LP, so it is annoying how long it takes for the game to check the DRM and restart.     And this game is pretty hard, which is one of its appeals.
Amazing and in-depth one of a kind system big fan of the Saga series
I love the game but the fact I can't play unless I have a internet connection is pissing me off. square-enix please put out a patch to make the game offline capable.
Greatest rpg of all times

Dont like how it has to authenticate every time i play it so I cannot play it at work during down time or lunch. Feel like I wasted of 20$ since I cant use it as a time killer as expected. I'm sure its a good game but DRM gets in the way of actually playing it. You are better off getting a ROM of the game.
Challenging and fun. Never had the chance to play it until now.
I bought it with legitimate means, why the D.R.M? Make it playable with a update for off line and I'm sure many other people will give it a higher rating.

Wish there is more control options. It's very hard to play with current control. Controller support would been nice. Update: this control really makes me mad. Update2 after android update save file was all gone.

Too bad, however, the translation is pretty terrible. I don't play these games for the riveting story, so the gameplay more than makes up for it. The additions to the mobile version make the otherwise imposing difficulty a bit more manageable. The sparking system is as addictive as ever, and makes each play through a unique and challenging experience. Shout out to Gideon Zhi for bringing this gem to my attention all those years ago.

Let's get the most important part out of the way - I paid 20 dollars for a game I cannot access on a bad connection because of always online DRM.  When publishers do stuff like this, it's really no wonder why anyone wouldn't pirate their games. Go pirate this game, DO NOT BUY IT.  The pirated version has no DRM, and is therefore superior to the version paying customers spent legitimate money on.
I think this not remake but reuse.Just old sprites on sfc and same song and full prize.Why?

I own ALL the premium squaresoft games on android.  This game has alot going for it.  Similar to FFIV or FFVI, it has the charismatic pixel characters that squaresof was known for in the mid 90s.  One major gripe is the battle touchscreen interface.  You have no auto battle, and you have click a lot of small areas on the battle screen many times before they register. Seems like a step backwards.  Very tedious. Great game. Tedious battle UI.
Every person add in party not give new formation?how to add formation

It's a great game and I've been enjoying so far. The challenge and having many different choices is great. I also like how open ended it is and that you can build up your home kingdom in different ways. However, even though I'm glad that the game was finally released in full English, I feel that the translations could've been a lot better and the touch controls could use some improvements. Also, auto dash should've been off by default as dashing into an enemy makes you lose your formation.

A classic that unfortunately never left Japan before, this is a true gem and perfectly suited to mobile gaming. If you enjoy RPGs then you're really missing out if you don't play this. Say no to micro-transaction crap and support the real games instead! [EDIT] Dropped from 5 stars to 4 as the controls need work and gamepad support would be a great addition. Will put back up to 5 if this is done.

It's fun and with a great storyline. Graphics are what you'd expect from a 1993 release. If the touch screen controls were calibrated properly it would be five stars. However charging $18 for a phone game with controls like this is borderline criminal... It gets frustrating real quick having to constantly hit the back button because the wrong command is chosen.
This is the worst rpg ever keep dying and this game sucks want my money back, hate this game,  terrible, the reviews are lying, too hard,   want my money back
No sound or music in game, but every first time battle sequence there's little music than missing. Why? Please help!! My phone asus zenfone 5, os 5.0, already check diagnostic speaker no prob.
Please add controller support or an on screen dpad

The original Super Famicom game has been my all-time favorite JRPG since I first learned Japanese. The remake controls are excellent. However, I had to give one star off for an iffy translation - certainly not enough to ruin the experience, but noticeably sloppy, especially if you're familiar with the original script.

Who the Hell is your provider? I only paid exactly $14.99 for this game. I want to say, "Thank you very much, Square Enix, for taking the time to bring back this amazing RPG from the Super Famicom era!". The gameplay is excellent and feels like a true RPG, however, I'm not too fond of the Y's-style-run-into-an-NPC-automatic-interaction. I prefer to manually interact with the NPCs using the same type of button as the Dash. I look forward to Romancing SaGa 3!

Very disappointing and over priced by about $25.  Virtual d pad needs a sensitivity slider, it is a real pain to use.  Would love a music and sound effect volume slider too.  The d for dash button is too big for what it is.  The controls make this game unpleasant to spend much time on

I was reluctant to buy this game, but I'm glad I did. The controls aren't bad once you're used to them. It helps if you use directional drags (like a d-pad) and not so much location based presses. Game play is smooth and fun and the added content and graphical update really add to the game and its replay value. I highly recommend this title of you're a fan of  this type of game.

Never played any of the Saga games before. But I have to say this is well worth the money. I hope,  SE localises the other Saga games! My only complaint is with the touchscreen controls,  I hope this will be fixed in the future.  Because as is, everything is a little too sensitive.

Great game, and overall very good port to a mobile interface. The controls are a bit sensitive, but not nearly as bad as others are saying. My only beef is with the license check: It's not just needing Internet access, but also Google access, which doesn't work in China without a VPN! Please do something about this, and I'll upgrade to five stars.

Let me start by saying that this game is a ton of fun to play. I'm really enjoying the story and mechanics. Unfortunately, like most classic games, when you try to play it on a touchscreen, everything falls apart. The controls are finicky and moving through menus is frustrating. Bluetooth controllers are HIGHLY recommended by me. There other problem is that Squeenix punishes the people who PAY for their products by requiring a connection to play. Just had a VERY boring plane flight. Thanks, Squeenix.
My most beloved game is back. :]
love it
They just need to fix those controls and they're all set. Otherwise great stuff.
Almost like SFC.Swipe control could use a tone to one step instead of multiple cursor move. Also some conversation choice could use a bullet button instead of tapping directly on the choice.
It's old school and to me, it's new. Because I wasn't a weirdo and didn't try to play it all those years ago when it wasn't in English.... Weirdos
And the remaster is well done. Here's hoping for RS3 next!

I enjoy it but this game can be extremely frustrating no doubt this is a hardcore Japanese game. My biggest problem is lack of direction , having one character with flee option. I like how it evolves in generations but a bloodline or continuance of a royal family would have kept me more interested. I like the game but find it boring after an hour.
this game is very good i really like it a lot please release all your saga series for android and please make more new saga games i like romancing saga and saga frontier series
The  things are good except the control... i dont know how they could improve this lol...
I saw the reviews so thought I would try it out but the controls are the thing that makes me not want to play more then 30 minutes. And selecting what attack you want is hard.
I bought this game for my travel but the game won't run if there's no internet because the game need to authenticate some bs.
I've been wanting to play this for decades. Thank you for bringing it to America at last! Now do RS3 :)

I have been playing this game a few hours now. My only complant are the controls. Movement feels like the touch screen isn't calibrated correctly. When moving left/right I'll ramdomly move up/down. Also sometimes when tap on the screen to select a option like attacking it doesn't respond. Swiping while in combat randomly stop responding as well. The controls are holding me back from giving this game a 5 star review. The lock up problems are getting worse the more that I play. Took 20 mins to finish a battle
Its getting difficult once you get used to it

I bought this to play on a tablet on my morning train ride, but it does a license check every single time the app launches which makes it unplayable for me. If it's a check the first time that's understandable, but I (over) paid for this app and can't even use it. Do not purchase if you're planning on playing it anywhere but home.
Loved it on super famicom and this re-release is fantastic. Hope we get others in the series.
Is it just me or is there no sound to this game?
Please release new update to fix this problem.
Some minor control quirks but so far a great game. One of Square enixs better Android ports

Seems like it should be a fun game but the controls feel hyper sensitive. There's no way to enable a touchpad interface aside from a tiny one used only as an indicator, and the action command is just touching the screen randomly. It needs some serious work.
It was one of the earliest JRPG I ever played and I love it so much but I don't understand Japanese. Finally the English version.

This is an awesome remake of a game that I had to use a fan translation for long ago.  The 90s offered some of the most amazing Squeenix titles of all time.  This is great and I hope that the FF Legends and RS3 are in the works for mobile devices as well.
Waiting long time for mobile version. Great job Squareenix. Plz remake another snes game, like Bahamut Lagoon , Livealive, etc

I have been waiting for this game for 23 years. I played it when it originally came out on the SFC in 1993. And through the years I replay it at least once a year in Japanese. Today, a 23 year wait is over. Some tips for new players to the series: get magic research center up early. You need 25 mp on your emperor and 1m in coins. Also, the best weapons are generally found but the best armor is generally made.
Glad to see that square still cares about this ip.  My only issue being the touch controls but once the vita version is released in the US i will just play that.
Love the game but the fact i need internet to play is absolutely stupid. Why not make game offline as well for people who dont have the option of having internet available to them where they live.
The movement system is terrible.

Just.... Wow. Before someone comes in whining about why a game involving massive amounts of time and money to create would cost 17 dollars, I want to tell them: this game isn't for you.  You will not understand, nor would this game likely be in your bag. If, however, you would like to finally play one of the best JRPGs to never be released in America, I'd like to happily reassure you: yes, it's as good as they say. If you played any of the Saga games and dug them, come on in!! Just keep the haters out.

I have literally been waiting for this at least half of my life, I'm a huge fan of the SaGa series and had always read this was the best one out of them all but I didn't know Japanese, so this is my chance. Thank you Squeenix for this!
I've waited for an English version of this game for 20 years.
One of my favorite super famicon games.  So glad it's on mobile
Gotta love retro!
I've got no word to say, but cheers!!!
Amazing classic
It was my favorite game since I was 13. Finally released it in better graphics.

I'm stoked they finally translated this and made it available. It's been locked away in Japan for 23yrs! I'm just showing my support for bringing these beloved games to gamers outside Japan. Kudos to you, SQEN.

userName: marcelotree g m a i l
content: It's a good time to be a Romancing SaGa fan! The first game was fan translated very recently and now we have the sequel in English (plus Romancing SaGa 3 is also in English.) The graphics are a giant improvement and we get the additional content from the 2010 Japanese cellphone version. What's there to think about, buy this already!
5 stars just for releasing it! The Saga series is one of the most underated games and I'm glad it's getting it's time in the sun. Great job SE. Now release romancing saga 3 lol
Beautiful game, upgraded graphics from snes... this is how you do an upgraded port, folks. Square enix did something right!
Thank you square enix
Been waiting years to play this in English. Thanks for bringing it over, SE.
